column4: hey guys... i have a dlink dwl-g610, card that is installed fine, but it wont connect to the wireless network. i have it working on windows. any ideas guys?
i am using ndiswrapper..
the hardware is installed
please pastebin the output of: sudo iwconfig
ok so now you want to configure it
sort of, yeah.
i do not think so they have a wiki on it in the ubuntu wiki
i followed it step by step, but in the end it doesnt work
what the wpa wiki? se if your card is supported by wpasupplicant: http://hostap.epitest.fi/wpa_supplicant/
you know.. 1 sec.. i think i made a booboo
ok i will be here
well, i may have got a new error:
did you even set your ssid?
and you said that you followed the wiki?
did you checl to see if your card was supported?
no i mean for wpasupplicant?
on the wpasupplicant supported list it has ndiswrapper.
no you have to see if your wireless card is supported
ndiswrapper just allows you to use windows drivers
no on this site
http://hostap.epitest.fi/wpa_supplicant/
oh ok i see what you are saying hold on
you did this: sudo wpa_supplicant -iath0 -c/etc/wpa_supplicant.conf -Dmadwifi -w
do you have a registered nick? if so can i pm you?
